item.title: Graduate Summer Lunch & Learn-Writing Research and Teaching Statements for Academic Careers- Registration Required | June 18
item.description: Date: Wednesday, June 18, 2025 12:00 PM - 2:30 PM - Writing Research and Teaching Statements for Academic Careers- Research and teaching statements are core components of the academic job application. In this lunch and learn, we will break down their key elements and offer strategies for translating your work and vision into compelling narratives. We’ll discuss how to tailor your statements to different institutions and articulate impact. Ideal for graduate students and postdocs preparing for…

item.title: Join the Rensselaer Consulting Club This Summer
item.description: Looking to gain real-world consulting experience this summer? Join the Rensselaer Consulting Club (RCC). Open to all undergrads, RCC offers hands-on projects in AI for small businesses and immigrant-led entrepreneurship. Build your resume, work with real clients, and make a local impact. No prior consulting experience needed. Just curiosity, commitment., flexible and collaborative. Interested? Contact Dr. Kevin Fletcher at fletck3@rpi.edu.

item.description: Date: Saturday, June 14, 2025 6:00 AM - 7:30 PM - ALL MAJORS WELCOME! item.title: School of Science Arch Field Trip: Yale Peabody Museum of Natural History | June 19
item.description: Date: Thursday, June 19, 2025 6:00 AM - 7:30 PM - ALL MAJORS WELCOME! Students will have the opportunity to engage with exhibits showcasing dinosaur fossils, ancient artifacts, minerals, and cultural treasures from around the world. Free breakfast and lunch will be provided. Meet at RPI Union horseshoe entrance at 6:00 AM, bus departure at 6:30 AM. Bus will return to RPI by 7:30 PM. Sign-up ends 4 PM on June 18.

item.title: TEM Sample Preparation Short Course
item.description: June 17, 9:00 AM- 12:00 PM - Lectures on techniques & material June 17, 1:00PM-5:00PM, June 24-June 26, 9:00AM-5:00PM - Practical Sessions (Sign Up Required)Participants will have the option to practice Transmission Electron Microscopy (TEM) sample preparation and TEM imaging with a sample from their own project. Submitting samples ahead of time is preferred to accommodate as many samples as possible. Lunch will be included, registration is limited to 25 participants.
